sub_title: Associate Professor - IHS Erasmus University Rotterdam - Head of Urban Environment and Climate Change Resilience
summary: Alberto Gianoli (PhD) is an economist and management specialist who works as a researcher and consultant at Erasmus University Rotterdam, the Netherlands. His main areas of expertise and interest include environmental economics and environmental finance, climate change adaptation and mitigation, urban environment and infrastructure, decision making analysis (e.g. cost-benefit and cost-effectiveness analysis, multi-criteria decision making), performance measurement and management, monitoring and evaluation, impact studies, urban and regional management and governance, and urban and regional (economic) development. He has completed a wide range of research and consultancy assignments and has held various positions including project coordinator, team leader, senior technical advisor, principal researcher and trainer. He has carried out assignments for the World Bank, Asian Development Bank, European Commission, United Nations (UNDP, UNEP, UN-HABITAT), OSCE and several national, regional and local governments world-wide. He has working experience in a number of countries including Italy, United Kingdom, Germany, Belgium, the Netherlands, Poland, Kosovo, Romania, South Africa, Namibia, Tanzania, Ethiopia, Uganda, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam, Myanmar, Philippines, Bangladesh and Curacao.

school.name: University of Bristol / University of York / University of Milan 'Luigi Bocconi'
